skill.name: tts-skill
skill.description: Multi-engine text-to-speech skill. Supports Qwen3-TTS local voice cloning, VoiceCraft online TTS, and OpenAI TTS.
skill.summary: Convert text to speech using multiple TTS engines with voice cloning support
skill.author: tabortao

security_audit.summary: Legitimate multi-engine TTS skill with standard software practices. Static scanner flagged patterns common in legitimate applications: subprocess calls for engine invocation, network requests to cloud TTS services, and environment variable access for API credentials. All findings evaluated as false positives - no malicious intent detected.

content.user_title: Convert text to natural speech with multiple TTS engines
content.value_statement: Converting text to speech manually requires complex setup and API keys. This skill provides a unified interface to multiple TTS engines including local voice cloning and cloud services.
actual_capabilities: Convert text to speech using Qwen3-TTS local voice cloning
Generate speech with VoiceCraft online TTS engine
Create audio using OpenAI TTS API with multiple voice options
List available voices and engines for each TTS service
Read text from files and convert to audio output
Install and configure TTS environments automatically
limitations: Local voice cloning requires reference audio files in assets directory
Cloud TTS engines require API keys for OpenAI TTS
Voice quality depends on the selected engine and configuration

use_cases.title: Content creators generating voiceovers
use_cases.description: Convert written scripts to natural speech for videos, podcasts, or presentations using voice cloning with reference audio samples.

use_cases.title: Accessibility and reading assistance
use_cases.description: Transform articles, documents, or books into audio format for hands-free consumption by users with visual impairments or those who prefer listening.

use_cases.title: Developers integrating TTS into workflows
use_cases.description: Add text-to-speech capabilities to automation pipelines, chatbots, or applications using a unified CLI interface.
use_cases.target_user: Software developers, DevOps engineers, AI practitioners

prompt_templates.title: Basic text to speech conversion
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the tts-skill to convert this text to speech: "{your text here}"
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple conversion using default voice and engine

prompt_templates.title: Voice cloning with custom reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Use tts-skill with qwen3-tts engine and voice "ÂØíÂÜ∞Â∞ÑÊâã" to convert this text: "{your text}"
prompt_templates.scenario: Voice cloning using a specific reference audio from assets

prompt_templates.title: Cloud TTS with specific voice
prompt_templates.prompt: Use tts-skill with edge-tts and voice "xiaoxiao" to convert: "{your text}"
prompt_templates.scenario: Online TTS with specific cloud voice selection

prompt_templates.title: File-based conversion with custom output
prompt_templates.prompt: Use tts-skill to convert the text from file "input/text.txt" using qwen3-tts with voice "Ëµµ‰ø°" and save to "output/custom.wav"
prompt_templates.scenario: Batch conversion from file with custom output path

best_practices: Prepare reference audio files in the assets directory for voice cloning with matching .txt transcript files
Configure API keys in engine config files before using cloud TTS services
Use the --list-voices command to explore available voices before generating audio
Test with short text first to verify voice and quality before processing longer content
anti_patterns: Do not use voice cloning without proper reference audio and transcript files in assets directory
Do not attempt to use cloud TTS engines without valid API keys configured
Do not skip environment setup for Qwen3-TTS - it requires specific Python version and dependencies

faq.question: What TTS engines are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports three engines: Qwen3-TTS (local voice cloning), VoiceCraft Edge TTS (online), and OpenAI TTS (cloud API). Each offers different voice options and quality levels.

faq.question: How does voice cloning work?
faq.answer: Place reference audio files (.mp3, .wav) in the assets directory with matching .txt files containing the transcript. Use the voice name as the --voice argument.

faq.question: Do I need API keys?
faq.answer: Qwen3-TTS and Edge TTS work without API keys. OpenAI TTS requires an OpenAI API key configured in the openai-tts.config file.

faq.question: What audio formats are supported?
faq.answer: Output formats vary by engine: Qwen3-TTS produces WAV files, OpenAI TTS produces MP3, and Edge TTS supports multiple formats configured in settings.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for commercial purposes?
faq.answer: Check the license terms of each engine. Qwen3-TTS and the skill itself are MIT licensed. OpenAI TTS usage is subject to OpenAI's terms of service.

faq.question: How do I install the Qwen3-TTS environment?
faq.answer: Run the skill with --install flag or call install_qwen3_environment(). This uses micromamba to create a Python 3.12 environment and install required packages.
